hed: 17 Musical Soundtracks to Add Into Your Life Immediately
socialTitle: 17 Musical Soundtracks to Add Into Your Life Immediately
seoTitle: Best Musical Soundtracks to Listen to - Hairspray, Rent, and more.

items.caption:
Nothing beats singing along to Taylor Swift during a endless car ride, but have you ever tried cranking up some Wicked and belting out "Defying Gravity"? We've embraced our inner theater fan-girl and compiled a list of the greatest, most addictive, and legit gorgeous musical soundtracks ever, and we're sharing the results (because sharing is caring, duh!). 

Check out Teen Vogue's favorite musical soundtracks and start singing your heart out.

items.title: __Mamma Mia!__
items.caption: If you've seen the movie adaptation of Mamma Mia! then you know just how amazing the soundtrack by Swedish pop sensation Abba is. Two words: Dancing Queen. That's literally all you need to know.

items.title: __The Sound of Music__
items.caption: __Fact:__ the hills are alive with the sound of music. And by "the hills," we mean our ipod, because this is a musical soundtrack staple. With hits like "My Favorite Things" and "Sixteen Going on Seventeen," it's basically the gift that keeps on giving. Thanks, Julie Andrews!

items.title: __Spring Awakening__
items.caption: If you have any doubt about how insanely good the Spring Awakening soundtrack is, know this: real life BFFs Jonathan Groff and Lea Michele were in the original cast. Plus, Spring Awakening won a Tony Award and a Grammy Award, just saying.

items.title: __Into the Woods__
items.caption: Thanks to the 2014 movie adaptation, we've had "Into The Woods" stuck in our heads on repeat for months –– but there are tons of other fab songs on the soundtrack. Favorites include "Stay with Me" (BRB, sobbing hysterically), and of course "Agony" (BRB, laughing hysterically).

items.title: __West Side Story__
items.caption: No list of soundtracks would be complete without Leonard Bernstein's West Side Story! This musical is crazy romantic and stands the test of time –– but heads up: you might start wandering the streets of NYC snapping your fingers and singing "Here Come The Jets" in your free time. It's happened to the best of us.

items.title: __Wicked__
items.caption: Idina Menzel became a household name while playing The Wicked Witch of the West in Wicked, and thanks to her powerhouse vocals the entire soundtrack is magical. No seriously, Adele Dazeem's (er, Idina Menzel's) rendition of "Defying Gravity" is jaw-dropping.

items.title: __Rent__
items.caption: Rent is the ultimate New York City musical, and the songs are pure brilliance. But watch out –– you might find yourself crying in the shower while singing "Seasons of Love." Here's Glee's version so you know what to expect (read: copious tears).

items.title: __South Pacific__
items.caption: South Pacific is about as old school as it gets, but there are definitely some musical gems. How could there not be? It's a Rodgers and Hammerstein! Plus, we can all relate to "I'm Gonna Wash That Man Right Outa My Hair," which is basically the '40s version of "Blank Space."

items.title: __Sweeney Todd__
items.caption: A musical about a murderous barber who sings in his free time? Yes, please. And bonus: if you check out the movie soundtrack, you'll get to hear Johnny Depp belt out some show tunes!

items.title: __Cabaret__
items.caption: Cabaret is on everyone's radar thanks to Emma Stone, Michelle Williams and Sienna Miller starring in the latest revival, and the music is a must. Unfortunately, the show packed up in March –– but you can always tune into the killer soundtrack!

items.title: __Hairspray__
items.caption: All you need to know about Hairspray is that Zac Efron was in the recent movie adaptation. What more could a person want? Really awesome music and a valuable message about segregation in the 1960s? Because it has that, too!

items.title: __Gigi__
items.caption: Vanessa Hudgens missed Coachella to star in the reincarnation of this Broadway musical, so you better believe it's good. Much like the show itself, the soundtrack is romantic, fun and dripping with style!

items.title: __Tick, Tick...Boom!__
items.caption: Not to be confused with the equally amazing "Tik Tik Boom" by Britney Spears, Tick, Tick...Boom! is a musical about a struggling composer living it up in the Concrete Jungle. The songs are catchy and thought-provoking, and definitely worth a listen!

items.title: __Jersey Boys__
items.caption: Jersey Boys is a documentary-style musical about 60s rock-n-roll group The Four Seasons, which means it's chock-full of iconic juke box hits! We're talking "Big Girls Don't Cry", "Sherry", and "Can't Take My Eyes Off You." Total classics –– with a Broadway makeover!

items.title: __In the Heights__
items.caption: In the Heights won the Tony Award for best musical, so obviously it has an amazing soundtrack. It was even nominated for a Pulitzer Prize –– that's how good it is. It's almost impossible to pick our favorite song from In the Heights, but you can't beat "96,000!" Side note: there needs to be more rapping in musical theater.

items.title: __A Chorus Line__
items.caption: Best. Musical. Ever. A Chorus Line is about –– you guessed it –– a chorus line on Broadway, and the entire soundtrack will make you want to tap dance like no one's watching. *Must find group of similarly heighted people to can-can with immediately.*

items.title: __Chicago__
items.caption: "All That Jazz," "Mr. Cellophane," and "Roxie" –– those are just a few of the brilliant songs from Chicago, a musical about two murderesses who moonlight as vaudeville performers. In other words, it's flawless.

seoDescription: We've embraced our inner theater fan-girl and compiled a list of the greatest musical soundtracks ever!
